subject: Career
title: The Six Causes of Burnout
description: A quick, practical guide to The Six Causes of Burnout.

hook.text: Most people blame overwork for burnout. But Maslach found six causes â€” and workload is just one of them.

buildup.text: The six: workload, control, reward, community, fairness, and values. Any mismatch can trigger burnout.

discovery.text: You can work reasonable hours but still burn out if you feel undervalued, powerless, or morally conflicted.

twist.text: The most common burnout cause isn't overwork â€” it's lack of control over how you do your job.

climax.text: Diagnose your burnout source: is it volume, autonomy, recognition, belonging, fairness, or meaning?

punchline.text: Burnout has six roots. Cutting hours won't help if the real root is unfairness.

quiz.question: What is the most common cause of burnout according to Maslach?
options: Lack of control over how you do your job
